content.description:
Start just left of the major dihedral using some side pulls and hidden underclings. Move up over the bulge using some crazy yoga moves / sidepull nonsense (crux 1). Stand on the ledge and clip the second bolt. Move up the face to the next ledge and clip the 3rd bolt out right (crux 2). From here the climb finishes through the same ending as Life is Suffering. Bring some cams for extra protection up here.

Starts left of the major dihedral.
3 bolts (upgraded to 4 bolts in 2017), top anchors. Bring cams for the ending, as this is potential deck territory. Please be very cautious with this climb, as the bolts are few and far between (although possibly much safer now).

The crux is at the very bottom. After the first crack you attain a ledge. Move up and left, to attain a dihedral. Easy climbing to the top.

This route starts a level lower than the other routes. This is the first crack route after the roof and the tree.
Gear to 2". There is a single bolt where I would expect this climb to end... Instead of rapping from there, I headed left to the bolts of Yoga Man. Not sure if this is the intended ending.

Very fun climb. Head up the boulder/seperated rock at the bottom left of the cliff - go ahead, wedge yourself in there. From here head up and right through the dihedral. This baby will take some great gear, up to 2". Head up under the roof, place some tiny cams, and head out right. Move up through some cool face climbing and end through a sweet crack.

This is the first climb in the area, on the very left, between the seperated rock feature and the cliff face.
Up to 2", bring tiny cams for the roof. Top anchors are shared with Desperate Measures.

Awesome climb for practicing hand jams. Head up through the small roof just right of the dihedral. From here move into the crack and head straight up. Don't be afraid to jam those hands and feet in there!

Just right of the dihedral.
Gear to 2.5", anchors at top.

Head up the dihedral.

Dihedral.
Set up a top-rope using anchors at the top.

The crux appears to be at the bottom. Follow a flak up and right, the pull over the lip and head straight up through a crack.

On the ledge to the right of the dihedral is the start of this climb. Look for the first set of bolts after Desperate Measures.
Two bolts at the start and then gear to 2.5". Shares anchors with Yoga Man to the right.

There are two cruxes for this climb: one at the very beginning and one at the end. Pull over the lip: Right hand on the ledge, right foot over the ledge (yeah!), and left hand way up to a hold that looks like it's seperated...but miraculously is not. Clip your second bolt and then head right and up to a huge flake (takes good gear in left), and then head left to attain a lay-back crack that takes great gear. Moving over the lip after the crack is the major crux (both physically and mentally). Look for hidden crimp over the lip.

Just right of Worst Case Scenario.
Two bolts at the beginning, then gear to 1". Bring a BD C4 0.3, 0.4, 0.5, and 0.75. Anchors at top.
Sunny in the morning and early afternoon. Pretty quiet despite its close proximity to town. Granite.
